column2: Picturing Acres - National Council of Teachers of Mathematics
column3: In the event of an oil spill at sea, satellite imaging is used to help scientists estimate the surface area involved so that engineers can determine the scope of the spill’s impact on the environment. Marine oil spills are often reported in terms of the number of acres covered. The Exxon Valdez oil spill in Prince William Sound, Alaska, in 1989, covered over 7 million acres. How large is an acre?

column2: Picturing Acres - National Council of Teachers of Mathematics
column3: Edited by Kevin Dykema, kdykema@mattawanschools.org, a teacher from Mattawan, Michigan, and Crystal Kalinec-Craig, crystal.kalinec-craig@utsa.edu, a mathematics educator in San Antonio, Texas. Manuscripts should show how math is used to solve a real-life problem, preferably in the context of one’s profession, and should be no more than 300 words. Submit manuscripts through http://mtms.msubmit.net.
